alert.note: Alert for Hughes; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 08 at 10:24AM CDT until June 08 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT FOR SEMINOLE...NORTHEASTERN PONTOTOC...CENTRAL POTTAWATOMIE AND SOUTHWESTERN HUGHES COUNTIES... At 1024 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Seminole to 5 miles southwest of Holdenville to near Francis, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Seminole, Holdenville, Wewoka, Konawa, Byng, Maud, Allen, Bowlegs, Francis, St. Louis, Sasakwa, Atwood, Spaulding, Lima and Harjo. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
